definition: (idiom) to say one thing and do another
words/speech/to say/to talk
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
(negative prefix)/not/no
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: The discrepancy means poor countries will end up bearing most of the burden themselves.
sentences.chinese: 這種言行不一意味着最終窮國將自己擔起大部分重擔。

sentences.english: If you don’t get your act together, will you ever get what you want?
sentences.chinese: 如果你言行不一致的話，你能夠實現你的願望嗎？

sentences.english: Despite the rhetorical force of her convictions, some Tory colleagues accuse her of inconsistency.
sentences.chinese: 儘管宣稱一以貫之，有些保守黨指責她言行不一。

sentences.english: His words don't agree with his action.
sentences.chinese: 他的所作所爲與他的言行不一致。

sentences.english: Your words and actions do not accord.
Especially for those whose deeds don't match their words.
sentences.chinese: 特別是那些言行不一致的人。

definition: heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
to be all talk and no action
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
two-faced person/double-dealing
dishonest
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
vice/immorality/moral turpitude
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
words and actions/what one says and what one does
to contradict oneself/self-contradictory/inconsistent
false/hypocritical/artificial/sham
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
